message:
Gama3aa so2aal mohem gedan a7san laptop ka materials w low heat w mfeesh problems fe display w mfhoosh mshakel 3amatan w y3eesh m3 elwa7ed 5 years Min. anhi wa7ed mn 5 brands dah :

Toshiba : Satellite S50T-CBT2G01

Dell : New Inspiron 15 7000 "Inspiron 7548"

Lenovo : Y50-70 '59440654'

Asus : ASUS ROG GL551JW

Msi : Msi GE62 Apache-276

Toshiba 1199$
Dell 1349$
Lenovo 1099$
Asus 1029$

data.message: If you are really looking for peoples' opinion, at least post the specs  of those laptops so we can compare. It is very unlikely that people will spend half an hour googling the specs and making comparisons on their own.

I didn't use those specific models, but to be honest, I used Toshiba Satellite for 5 years, it gets very VERY hot, also I think any Toshiba laptop is overpriced 

afterwards I bought a new Asus, it has a touchscreen, and since I am using Linux, I find some display issues, also it comes with Windows 8, and the default color configuration is very hot, by hot I mean the I feel everything is getting red,

And about dell, I didn't have one before, but my friends say it gets very hot too

The Dell has a U processor, so I would personally steer away from it. The 5700HQ and the 4720HQ are nearly identical, so I would go with Toshiba, the SSD gives it an edge.

Another point to put into consideration is the size and weight of the laptop. Good luck.
Apparently you want a laptop for gaming, so you should go with MSI. You can check the reviews on the internet.
